alert.note: Alert for Grand (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 23 at 6:10PM MDT until August 23 at 7:30PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR EAST CENTRAL GRAND COUNTY... At 610 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms have ended for the day, but earlier storms produced from 0.3 to 1.0 inches of rain this afternoon. However, local authorities indicated no impacts so far from these storms. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, gulches, roads, and poor drainage and low-lying areas, especially Soda, Stillwater, and Supply Creeks. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Grand Lake. This includes the following additional locations... Rocky Mountain National Park west entrance, Columbine Lake, rising water in the Colorado River along River Rd and Lower Stillwater Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Heavy Rainfall will cause flash flooding of small creeks, streams, and ditches in the East Troublesome burn area. Rock slides or debris flows can also be expected across rural roads.
